questions.answer_description:
One use of the SysObsoleteAttribute class is to notify the compiler that the compile should fail if a particular method is called in the source code. The compiler rejects the compile, and displays the specific message that is stored in this use of the attribute.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/dev-ref/xpp-attribute-classes
questions.question_text:
You are a Dynamics 365 Finance developer. You create a class.
You need to mark the class to ensure that when code is compiled, the process fails if a specific method is called in the source code.
Which attribute should you use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Correct answer is C and a tool used in this question is Matadata search: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/dev-tools/metadata-search-visual-studio

Selected Answer: C
Is there a type "class code"? https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/dev-tools/application-explorer ?

Selected Answer: C
Crosscompani code is the key to the answer

Selected Answer: C
C is right one

Selected Answer: C
C should be correct

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

questions.question_text:
A company uses Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management.

You need to list all classes in the Application Suite model that contain a cross-company query.

Which query string should you use?

choices.D: type:class, method name=insert code:"crosscompany" model:"Application Suite"
choices.A: type:class, method name=run code:"crosscompany" model:"Application Suite"

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

A company uses Dynamics 365 Finance.

You implement the unit test framework. You must automate the testing for previously developed functionality.

You need to create unit tests in Visual Studio.

Which five actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
For me: Y, N, Y, N
I don't think you can add a condition to line 18 as next cannot be called conditionally

comments.content: Y,Y,Y,N , A static method can be wrapped and extend

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Dynamics 365 Finance environment.

You have the following code: (Line numbers are included for reference only.)

//IMG//


For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

DRAG DROP
-

A company uses Dynamics 365 Finance.

You must implement three classes with the following requirements:

• Variables in ClassA must be accessible from ClassA and its child classes but not from other classes. ClassB is a class that inherits from ClassA.
• ClassC is not a parent or child class of any other class. The variables of ClassC must only be accessible within ClassC.

You need to complete the implementation.

Which variable modifiers should you use? To answer, drag the appropriate variable modifiers to the correct class names. Each variable modifier may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//
